greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle read by rows where T(n,k) is the number of labeled simple graphs covering n vertices with exactly k endpoints (vertices of degree 1).
comment: A graph is covering if there are no isolated vertices.
link: Andrew Howroyd, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..1325
formula: Column-wise inverse binomial transform of A327369.
E.g.f.: exp(-x)*exp(x + U(x,y) + B(x*(1-y) + R(x,y))), where R(x,y) is the e.g.f. of A055302, U(x,y) is the e.g.f. of A055314 and B(x) + x is the e.g.f. of A059167. - _Andrew Howroyd_, Oct 05 2019
program: my(U=sum(n=2, n, x^n*sum(k=1, n, stirling(n-2, n-k, 2)*y^k/k!)) + O(x*x^n));
my(R=sum(n=1, n, x^n*sum(k=1, n, stirling(n-1, n-k, 2)*y^k/k!)) + O(x*x^n));
my(A=exp(-x + O(x*x^n))*exp(x + U + subst(B-x, x, x*(1-y) + R)));
xref: Row sums without the first column are A327227.
results.author: _Gus Wiseman_, Sep 05 2019
ext: Terms a(28) and beyond from _Andrew Howroyd_, Oct 05 2019
